security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only design guidance and best practices. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no external commands. This is a static markdown file that provides Claude with design thinking instructions.

content.value_statement: Users struggle with generic AI-generated frontend code that lacks distinctive aesthetics. This skill provides design thinking guidance to create unique, production-ready interfaces with intentional visual direction and creative execution.
actual_capabilities: Guide creation of unique frontend interfaces avoiding generic AI aesthetics
Provide design thinking framework (purpose, mood, constraints, differentiation)
Recommend distinctive typography, color schemes, and visual treatments
Direct implementation of production-ready HTML, CSS, and framework code
Apply creative animations and motion design principles
Create spatial compositions with unexpected layouts and visual details
limitations: Does not generate backend code or server-side functionality
Does not access project files or existing codebases
Does not validate accessibility compliance or run tests
Does not integrate with design tools like Figma or Sketch

use_cases.title: Build distinctive UI components
use_cases.description: Create memorable web components with unique visual identity instead of generic templates

use_cases.title: Design complete page layouts
use_cases.description: Develop visually compelling pages with intentional aesthetics and polished implementation

use_cases.title: Prototype creative concepts
use_cases.description: Translate design vision into working code with bold aesthetic choices

prompt_templates.title: Create basic component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a button component with unique typography and unexpected hover effects. Choose a bold aesthetic direction and commit to it fully.

prompt_templates.title: Design landing page
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a landing page hero section. Pick an extreme mood: retro-futurism or organic natural. Use distinctive fonts and a cohesive color palette.

prompt_templates.title: Add complex animations
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a page with scroll-triggered animations. Use staggered reveals and surprising hover states. Focus on high-impact moments.

prompt_templates.title: Build full feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a dashboard interface with widgets, navigation, and data displays. Use an industrial-utilitarian aesthetic with bold typography and controlled density.

output_examples.input: Create a login form with a distinctive aesthetic
output: Login form with brutalist visual style: heavy borders, bold monospace typography, high-contrast color scheme
CSS custom properties for consistent design tokens across all form elements
Smooth focus transitions and subtle button hover animations
Responsive layout with unexpected spacing and asymmetric form alignment

best_practices: Commit to a clear aesthetic direction before coding and execute it with precision throughout the entire interface
Use distinctive fonts that create memorable visual identity instead of common choices like Inter or Roboto
Apply animation deliberately to high-impact moments like page load reveals rather than scattered micro-interactions
anti_patterns: Using generic AI-generated aesthetics: system fonts, purple gradients, predictable layouts, and template-based components
Converging on common design choices across different projects instead of creating unique visual identities
Failing to match implementation complexity with aesthetic vision: minimalist designs need precision while maximalist designs need elaborate code

faq.question: What frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance for any frontend framework including React, Vue, vanilla HTML/CSS/JS, and other modern frameworks.

faq.question: Does this skill work with CSS frameworks like Tailwind?
faq.answer: Yes. You can request Tailwind or other CSS framework implementations. The design principles apply regardless of implementation approach.

faq.question: How does this differ from standard code generation?
faq.answer: This skill emphasizes creative design thinking, distinctive aesthetics, and intentional visual choices rather than generic code patterns.

faq.question: Does this skill access my project files?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-only skill that provides design guidance. It does not read, write, or access any external files.

faq.question: Why do my designs look generic?
faq.answer: Avoid common choices: Inter font, purple gradients, symmetric layouts. Request specific aesthetics like brutalist, retro-futurist, or organic styles.

faq.question: Can I combine this with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Use this skill for interface design, then combine with code review or commit skills for complete development workflows.
